name: VLOOKUP
description: Looks for a value in the first column of a table array and returns a value in the same row from a column you specify.
useCase: Find an employee's salary by looking up their name in a table.

syntaxVariants.notes: range_lookup is TRUE by default (approximate match)
is_sorted is TRUE by default (approximate match)

name: Pivot Table
description: A tool that summarizes and reorganizes selected data to reveal patterns and relationships within your data.
example: Summarize sales by region and product category
useCase: Analyze large datasets to identify trends and create summary reports.

implementations.instructions:
1. Select your data range
2. Go to Insert tab > PivotTable
3. Choose where to place the PivotTable
4. Drag fields to the Row, Column, Values, or Filter areas
implementations.notes: Use the PivotTable Fields pane to customize your view

implementations.instructions:
1. Select your data range
2. Go to Data > Pivot table
3. In the sidebar, add rows, columns, values, and filters
implementations.notes: Can also use Insert > Pivot table

implementations.instructions:
1. Select a cell within your data table
2. Choose Data > Pivot Table (or click Table button in toolbar)
3. Configure categories and values in the sidebar
implementations.notes: Numbers creates a new sheet for the Pivot Table

name: IF
description: Runs a logical test and returns one value for TRUE result, and another for FALSE result.
useCase: Categorize values as 'High' if greater than 10, otherwise 'Low'.

name: SUMIF
description: Adds the numbers in a range that meet a single condition.
useCase: Sum all sales amounts where the quantity is greater than 10.

syntaxVariants.notes: Uses semicolons and requires all parameters

name: TEXTJOIN
description: Combines text from multiple ranges or strings with a delimiter.
useCase: Combine first, middle, and last names into a single full name column.

name: Conditional Formatting
description: Applies formatting (e.g. color) based on cell values or conditions.
example: Highlight all sales greater than $5000 in green.
useCase: Visually identify high-performing sales or outliers.

implementations.instructions:
1. Select your range
2. Go to Home > Conditional Formatting
3. Choose a rule type and set conditions
4. Apply formatting
implementations.notes: Can also use formulas for custom rules

implementations.instructions:
1. Select your range
2. Format > Conditional formatting
3. Set the condition and formatting style
4. Click Done
implementations.notes: Supports custom formulas for advanced rules

implementations.instructions:
1. Select the cells
2. Format sidebar > Cell > Add a Conditional Highlighting Rule
3. Choose condition and style
implementations.notes: Limited compared to Excel and Sheets, but effective for basic use cases
